frameDefinitions: An Experiencer can be described as having an emotion as induced by a Stimulus.
A group of Arguers (also expressible as Arguer1 and Arguer2) express incompatible opinions or beliefs about an Issue.
An Experiencer is in an undesirable Situation, whose Explanation may also be expressed.
An Experiencer has an easy or difficult time carrying out an Activity.
These are words relating to emptying containers and clearing areas of some substance or items.
The adjectives and nouns in this frame describe an Experiencer who is feeling or experiencing a particular emotional response to a Stimulus or about a Topic.
frameExamples: The children <t>enjoyed</t> noise games and sing-songs.
We <t>bickered</t> about semantics for an hour.
The insurers ended up in the <t>bind</t> of having to pay 15 years' taxes.
The players <t>emptied</t> the bucket over his head.
Mr. Whiskers is <t>upset</t> that there are no more cat treats.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has an emotion as caused by the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
A group of people in an argument.
A person who is arguing with Arguer2.
The person who is being argued with by <fen>Arguer1</fen>.
The the thing the the <fen>Arguers</fen> are arguing over or about.
The time when the argument takes place.
The location at which the <fen>Arguers</fen> quarrel
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is in an undesirable <fen>Situation</fen>.
This role identifies the undesirable <fen>Situation</fen> the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is in.
Thiis role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Situation</fen> is in effect.
The location where the <fen>Situation</fen> occurs.

This Frame Element marks expressions indicating the <fen>Activity</fen> that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> finds difficult or easy. In many cases, the relevant <fen>Activity</fen> has to be inferred from the context.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate which person judges carrying out the <fen>Activity</fen> to be easy or difficult.
The time at which the <fen>Activity</fen> takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the entity that does the emptying.
The <fen>Theme</fen>, when overtly expressed, invariably occurs in a PP Complement headed by 'of'.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the region or container which is emptied of something.  In this frame, the <fen>Source</fen> occurs as an NP Object.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-sentient force which instigates the emptying.
The time at which the emptying takes place.
The location where the emptying takes place.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.

The Frame Element <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a body part, gesture or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The insurers</fex> ended up in a bind.
They found themselves in a quite <fex>a fix</fex>.
<fex>Yesterday's</fex> predicament was a little too exciting.
The trouble <fex>in America</fex> is only going to get worse.
The geology question on the exam was hard <fex>for me</fex>.
<fex>A basic washing</fex> can degrease your workclothes.
The prisoners were deloused <fex>in June and August</fex>.
Nan Ho turned, <fex>his</fex> extreme agitation unnoticed by the Prince.
Liz's anger <fex>towards Raquel</fex> dates back to a charity dinner this year.
'Can I help you?' she asked, trying not to let him see the amusement <fex>in her blue eyes</fex>.
The end of the film was filled with jubilant <fex>scenes</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Ministry of the Attorney General
the Association in Defence of the Wrongly Convicted –
A Guide to Consent and Capacity Law
